title: Why are defensive stats so useless? I want to actually tank again.
body: The past 2 games I've played I've built a plethora of defensive stats and no matter what, I will get destroyed instantly. Does not matter if I stack resists, stack HP, follow the perfect gold efficient balance of the 2, I cannot survive any engagement at all for more than 2 or 3 CC'd seconds. Penetration items are so stupidly gold efficient that one LW or VS can negate a couple thousand effective HP, and there is so much % HP damage in this game now after your resists are shredded to nothing. I know all you do is buy yourself "time" with defensive items, but when they're negated so easily, why bother?

replies.body: The issue is that defensive items are horribly cost-inefficient compared to their offensive counter-parts.  To make matters worse, there's no sufficiently beefy HP item to provide a soft-counter to %Pen (+25% bonus HP item, Rito plz).  To make matters even *worse* %Pen is a double-dip stat.  It scales off both YOUR damage AND the enemy's resistance.  If it were changed to scale ONLY off the target's resistance (like, say, bonus True Damage based on how much Ar/MR they have) then it would be much more manageable as well as making it clear to players that the counter is building HP instead of more resist.

Fix:

Raise the armor and magic resist on items. Bring in an added feature to select items that blocks 40-50% of critical strikes. And lastly, raise tank item HP bonus.
{{item:3105}} - from 200 to 300 bonus HP
{{item:3151}} - from 300 to 350 bonus HP
{{item:3143}} - from 500 to 600 bonus HP
{{item:3027}} - from 450 to 500 bonus HP (and mana)
{{item:3065}} - from 400 to 500 bonus HP
{{item:3083}} - from 800 to 1000 bonus HP
{{item:3050}} - from 250 to 300 bonus HP
{{item:3116}} - from 400 to 500 bonus HP
These changes will help champions by so much in the long run. Especially champions that because of health, armor, and magic resist nerfs {{champion:154}} will be able to be played again.

So basically make damage items irrelevant

Gotcha

It depends on what it should be for. But, I'm glad you sort-of get what I'm try to say. Yes, I want damage items to deal less damage to Tanks. Why? Because, if I were to tank as a {{champion:12}} or {{champion:59}} I would need some serious health or armor/magic resist for all these new champions that can critical like no tomorrow. 

If we gave Tanks more health in items like {{item:3102}} {{item:3143}} and {{item:3068}} then we might see more of it in game. But, with decreased health means Tanks become less powerful and more vulnerable because of their low ratio's and how the kits are.

For someone like {{champion:119}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:222}} or {{champion:64}}, they deal a lot of damage with little effort. And with the measly amounts of Armor, we can't seem to be able to cope with the damage they can give. Being, they each give out tons of AD damage, really fast.

And, when up against {{champion:103}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:99}} or {{champion:90}} there isn't much Magic Resist to stop the immensely more powerful attack from coming. 

Now, we see that items like {{item:3035}} and {{item:3071}} can just go through what you have and the same goes for Magic Resist with items like {{item:3151}} and {{item:3135}} that basically make getting Magic Resist not only a must but something that shouldn't be so worried about.

But, what blocks critical? Especially when all critical items give either bonus AS or AD (1 gives Armor Penetration). 

So, as much as sarcasm is lovable, please understand that damage will always deal damage. But Tanks should be able to take the damage and still continue living. 

Why is it that when I get a lot of HP and MR and Armor and yet, I still died because the enemy Jinx decided to get some critical and Armor Penetration? Why is it, that every Tank's early game starts out squishy? Why is it that Tanks are needed, but only as shields to take all the damage? Well, Tanks won't be able to do this when all the HP/Armor/Magic Resist items get nerfed so that it won't be *as hard* to kill a Tank like it used to be.

> The issue is that defensive items are horribly cost-inefficient compared to their offensive counter-parts.

MR items like SV are pretty cost efficient. So is FH, actually. It's the stuff like Sunfire, Omen and Thornmail that's under 100% due to immense power of their unique effects.

> To make matters worse, there's no sufficiently beefy HP item to provide a soft-counter to %Pen (+25% bonus HP item, Rito plz).

That would feel bad for any Thornmail/FH users. +15% total HP would've been much better here. Anyways, **the problem here is BotRK**, which is so good on its own **it's picked up even if nobody builds any health at all**. It invalidates any HP stacking before it can even happen. IMO BotRK needs to get split into two items, one for the passive and one for the active.

> To make matters even worse %Pen is a double-dip stat. It scales off both YOUR damage AND the enemy's resistance.

This one I don't agree with. It takes your damage, which you would deal if the enemy wasn't armored, and then reduces the number (armor, MR) that is used to mitigate this damage. **The problem with %penetration is that it's more effective against squishies than it should be.** LW and VS should have 50% bonus penetration, not 35% total.

BoTRK is countered pretty easily by Warden's Mail's passive, if not armor in general. Just having 100-160 armor - easily attainable - invalidates half that %HP damage and already blocks a good chunk of their initial damage output.
I wouldn't mind seeing the active disappear, though.

Making them bonus penetration makes "the problem" worse. Squishies get slightly less squishy while tank items become horribly inefficient.

If LW has 50% bonus armor penetration instead of 35%, the difference kicks in above about 150-200 armor.

Let's say you're a tank with 400 armor and the enemy got LW. Sure, your armor stacking got halved, but you've still got *some* of it and the enemy ADC has sacrificed an item slot just for you. This version of LW does not amplify their damage against your squishies. So in a way, you're indirectly saving your team :)

The only problem I see is with LW and VS. Even against low amounts of armour/mr they are as strong or stronger than other penetration items,  and they are ridiculously cheap. 

Their effects should either be reduced to around 20% (I don't like this though because their should be a way to deal with tanks), or their gold cost should be increased to the 3000 range (meaning they need new recipes because the combine cost would be insane). 

I just think it's wrong that LW is core on every adc even when no one on the enemy team has even bought armour,  and void staff the same for ap against no mr. 

I guess a third option would be to leave the price but change the stats to be ONLY penetration.  So the item is really slot inefficient if the other team doesn't have a tank at least.

I think VS is probably ok, because it is terrible against squishies.

However, squishies still get armor per level, so LW is still pretty useful.

I think reworking both items to use %bonus rather than %total is the right answer.

Honestly all armor pen items need at the very least some soft reworking done.

Every single AD champion can build all 3 of the armor pen items, and not have a single problem because of the sheer amount of stats and power each one gives.

This basically means that they not only invalidate the squishies, but they also invalidate he tanks as well despite the fact that their build should only be countering tanks (because the squishies are not building armor, and if they are it is in very small amounts, IE zhonya or Guardian angel)

The problem stems from the fact that it's much easier to build high amounts of AP than AD, and yet for some reason even easier to build higher amounts of Armour than Magic Resist.

Barring additional effects, MR items have a very noticeable smaller amount than their friends in the Armour section. There are two armour items that give +100 armour while the highest amount of MR an item will have is 55 - almost half of the amount of armour. Not to mention there are several MR items that aren't necessarily relative to tanking  - Mercurial Scimitar, Wit's End, Abyssal Scepter, Athene's Unholy Grail, Maw of Malmortius, etc. while most armour items are build to tailor to the needs of tanks - Frozen Heart with its mana and passive, Thornmail with its passive, etc.

I think that sometime this season, we need to see Armour and MR being addressed.

Being tanky in this game IS easy. % health things suck, yeah, but that makes someone have to make the choice of either using their abilities or actives(aside from gnar) to try to take down the tank, a non-damage dealing character, or use them on higher priority targets. Being a tank means you break the front line, take the hard cc the enemy gives you, and let the rest of your team attack the enemy. If a fight goes in your favor, you're either dead, having taken a LOT of CC, but your team has won the fight, or you're being ignored and are disrupting the enemy team from the interior.

I agree with this. There's this misconception that just because you are tanky you're supposed to survive everything when, in reality, if a team invests all of their resources into taking you down then you should die--but that would still be worth it because all of their abilities are now on cooldown and the rest of your team can mop them up with ease. Tanks are there to soak up damage so it doesn't land on your squishies and to disrupt the enemy team by forcing their carries away from the fight.

Tanks are strongest right after the laning phase when the carries haven't built their penetration items yet and by late game you should be transitioning into at least one damage item. Most tanks without reliable hard CC these days need to have at least one damage item by late game so they can chunk enemy carries before they're killed, then your own carries will hopefully be able to finish the enemy off. If you build pure tank then you should at least have some form of hard CC to keep them from dumping on you right away and give your carries the chance to delete them.

I agree that tanks (especially health stackers) haven't been feeling especially tanky for a while now, which is kind of a loss of fantasy for players of champs like Nautilus, Dr. Mundo, Singed, Zac, etc.

All in all, this wouldn't change much, but I think it would probably be a healthy nudge and it is slight enough that it wouldn't require other major rebalancing alongside it...

Also, here is an idea for a change in defense masteries:
> ~~Runic Blessing: Start the game with a 50 Health Shield.  The shield regenerates each time after respawning~~ -> Mastery removed; Legendary Guardian shifted into its position on skill tree.

|

> Tenacious: Reduces the duration of crowd control effects by 15% -> Effect unchanged but mastery moved down a tier in the skill tree (into Legendary Guardian's previous position).  **Requires 1 point in Swiftness.**

|

> **\*NEW\*** Unbreakable: Reduces the effectiveness of Armor and Magic penetration effects by 25%.  Requires 20 points in Defense.


I feel this would be a much more suitable final mastery for Defense (I don't think many people will mind Runic Blessing being phased out either) while providing a much needed buff to one of the non-offense trees.  Obviously, players using this mastery would need to be quite invested in defense (IE., a real tank) for this to be effective due to the 20 Defense mastery points requirement.  

Here are examples of how this would play out in a game:

Player A -
300 Armor (no Unbreakable mastery)

Player B - 
300 Armor (with Unbreakable mastery)

Player C -
Last Whisper [35% armor negation] + Brutalizer [10 flat armor pen]


Example 1 -
Player A is attacked by Player C -> 300 Armor - (300 * 0.35 [Last Whisper] + 10 [Brutalizer]) = 185 effective armor on Player A

Example 2 -
Player B is attacked by Player C -> 300 Armor - ((300 * 0.35 [Last Whisper] + 10 [Brutalizer]) * 0.75 [Unbreakable]) = 213.75 effective armor on Player B.  

In this case, this is equivalent to Last Whisper's armor penetration effect being reduced from 0.35 to 0.2625 and Brutalizer's flat pen being reduced from 10 to 7.5.

Two major problems with tanks:

1) Bruisers have slightly less survivability (they die in four seconds instead of five) while bringing significantly more damage than tanks. Why play a tank when you can be a tanky champ that also does damage? The two classes need to be separated more to prevent one from doing the other's job and then some.

2) Penetration itemization needs to have a downside. When a carry picks up {{item:3135}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3151}} they gain tons of damage against resistant targets like tanks and bruisers, while also still gaining quite a bit of damage against squishy targets as well. When you have tank buster items like that, buying them should be a big decision since they should greatly increase your damage against tanks, but don't give enough offensive power to let you continue to murder anyone who isn't a tank like you bought another damage item instead. You should have to choose, either do lots of damage to tanks but leave your tanks and bruisers to clean up their carries, or be able to kill their carries in two autos but leave someone else to deal with their tanks and bruisers. Not both with the same items.
